SENT.plain: One hundred and eighty-five patients with ulcerative colitis have been studied serially while receiving regular maintenance treatment with sulphasalazine (SASP) in a dose of 0.5 g four times daily
The circulating levels of the drug and its principal metabolites during remission do not influence the liability to relapse
When relapse does occur, the circulating level of sulphapyridine falls and remains depressed until remission occurs
This fall during a relapse is most pronounced when the patient suffers from universal colitis and is least marked in cases of distal colitis
